title: Is a diploma in information technology enough to get a good job? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh dear! What is a “diploma”? The answer depends on where you live and where you intend to work. There are no absolute and strict definitions, so the there’s no answer. I, for example, have something called a “Graduate Diploma in Information Technology” which is a qualification intended for people who did a lot of studying in non computing areas, and then a year in IT in the honours program. It certainly takes some work to convince people in other countries that you have an honours degree in IT, but did a lot of studying in such relevant areas like Renaissance Literature in Translation and early German Cinema!

If it is about getting a good job, then yeah, you will definitely get a good job after doing diploma in Information and Technology. But it is not enough, I must say. Today, technology has become an integral part of our everyday life and the demand for IT people is rapidly growing. That’s why the competition becomes tough and people need to work hard and hard to earn well. However, there are some companies where a degree doesn’t matter, but only a person’s knowledge matters most. IT people must keep themselves updated. The higher the degree and knowledge you have, the more successful you will become.
